text.text: How do I enable rolling itemized charges into the base rate?

text: To enable rolling into the base rate, you can click Admin > Billing > Payers > Click the payer name > Click on the Requirements field and select Roll supplies and additional services into the base rate charge.

text.text: Can you explain how to roll itemized charges into the base rate for a payer?

text: To enable rolling into the base rate, you can click Admin > Billing > Payers > Click the payer name > Click on the Requirements field and select Roll supplies and additional services into the base rate charge.

text.text: What are the steps involved in adding itemized charges to the base rate?

text: To enable rolling into the base rate, you can click Admin > Billing > Payers > Click the payer name > Click on the Requirements field and select Roll supplies and additional services into the base rate charge.

text.text: Explain how to view active charges and submitted charges for rolled charges on the Claim page?

text: You can view active charges and submitted charges for rolled charges on the Claim page. The Charges tab displays the active charges on the claim. The Submission history tab shows past submitted charges.

text.text: How can I justify base rate charges to a payer?

text: When you post a payment to the claim the system will take the percentages defined in the contract and divide up the remainder of the payment across each incidental charge.

text.text: how to work with contracts when rolling charges into the base rate

text: When you have a contract with a payer and you are rolling charges into your base rate, when you post a payment to the claim the system will take the percentages defined in the contract and divide up the remainder of the payment across each incidental charge.

text.text: how Medicare handles rolling charges into the base rate

text: Medicare will always pay only a base rate and mileage based on the fee schedule. You don't have to change the requirement field to include rolling into the base rate - this setting is done for you. In addition, the system will not distribute the payment to any charge other than the base rate or mileage. With Medicare, you cannot charge the customer for any ancillary supply charges.

text.text: Guide me through enabling the rolling into the base rate feature for a payer

text: To enable rolling into the base rate, you can turn on rolling into the base from the policy or benefit level by clicking on the Requirements field and selecting Roll supplies and additional services into the base rate charge.

text.text: What considerations should I keep in mind when rolling itemized charges into the base rate

text: When rolling itemized charges into the base rate, you should keep in mind that mileage and non-covered mileage is always a separate line item and is never rolled into the base rate. For Medicare and flat rate contracts, the CO-45 will increase by the amount of the rolled charges. Rolled charges will always get a zero dollar payment from Medicare.

text.text: Explain the impact of rolling charges into the base rate on Medicare payments

text: When rolling charges into the base rate, Medicare will always get a zero dollar payment.

text.text: Show me how to navigate the Submission history and Charges tab on the Claim page

text: The Submission history tab can be found in the Audit trail and Billing lifecycle tabs on the Claim page. The Charges tab displays the active charges on the claim. The Print charges details link opens a page in a separate tab that shows a list of active charges that are currently on the claim.

text.text: Provide examples of scenarios where rolling charges into the base rate would be beneficia

text: If you have a contract with a payer and you are rolling charges into your base rate, when you post a payment to the claim the system will take the percentages defined in the contract and divide up the remainder of the payment across each incidental charge.

text.text: How do I handle mileage charges when rolling itemized charges into the base rate

text: Mileage and non-covered mileage is always a separate line item and is never rolled into the base rate.

text.text: Can you demonstrate how to manage contracts and payments when rolling charges into the base rate

text: When you work a claim, the system gives you the option to use your universal rates or apply rates from a category. When you have a contract with a payer and you are rolling charges into your base rate, when you post a payment to the claim the system will take the percentages defined in the contract and divide up the remainder of the payment across each incidental charge.

text.text: Explain the significance of rolling itemized charges into the base rate for billing

text: ZOLL Billing has the ability to roll itemized charges into the base rate (also called lumping). When you set this feature as a payer requirement, itemized charges will be rolled into the base rate. For example, if your base rate is 1100, you can combine the itemized charges resulting in a base rate of 1300.

text.text: Enable rolling into the base?

text: To enable it, you can click Admin > Billing > Payers > the payer name > Requirements field > Roll supplies and additional services into the base rate charge.

text.text: How to add itemized charges to the base rate

text: To add itemized charges to the base rate, you can click the Charges tab and then click the Itemize supplies link at the top of the page. A pop-up window will display. You will see open, blank fields under the "Supply item" and "Supply type" fields.

text.text: Medicare and rolling into the base rate?

text: Medicare will always pay only a base rate and mileage based on the fee schedule. You don't have to change the requirement field to include rolling into the base rate - this setting is done for you. In addition, the system will not distribute the payment to any charge other than the base rate or mileage. With Medicare, you cannot charge the customer for any ancillary supply charges.

text.text: How to work with contracts?

text: A contract is an agreement with an insurance company or facility that defines the amounts that they will pay you for services and supplies every time you bill that payer or facility. Within ZOLL Billing, contractual amounts are associated with the payer or facility. When you send an invoice to a contracted facility, or submit a claim to a contracted payer, the system uses the configured contractual amounts to determine the expected payment.

text.text: where can i view active charges and submitted charges?

text: You can view active charges and submitted charges for rolled charges on the Claim page. The Submission history tab displays past submitted charges.

text.text: How can i view past submitted charges?

text: You can view past submitted charges in the Submission history tab.

text.text: explain in detail about Submission history?

text: The Submission history tab displays past submitted charges. There will be an entry for each claim submission in ascending order.

text.text: rolling into the base?

text: Rolling into the base is a payer requirement set at the Policy or Benefit plan levels. To enable it, you can click Admin > Billing > Payers. You can turn on rolling into the base from the policy or benefit level by clicking on the Requirements field and selecting Roll supplies and additional services into the base rate charge.
For more information click this: https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=moq6utfcqw
